          if (n==1) then

          else

          s = trim(adjustl(str1))

     5. Now, we run the second program on the string s.

        Steps:

          Let k = 1
          co(1, k) = 0   ! x
          co(2, k) = 0   ! y

          Then for each character in s:

             k = k+1
             if char is 'L': then x = x-1
             else if 'R': x=x+1
             else if 'U': y=y+1
             else if 'D': y=y-1
             else: do nothing (x,y unchanged)

             then set co(1,k)=x, co(2,k)=y

          Let npoints = k

          Then we set flag = .true. do i=1, npoints-3
             do j=i+3, npoints
                 dx = abs(co(1,i)-co(1,j))
                 dy = abs(co(2,i)-co(2,j)) if ( (dx<=1 .and. dy==0) .or. (dy<=1 .and. dx==0) ) then
                     flag = .false. exit
                 endif
             enddo
             if (.not. flag) exit
          enddo

          if (flag) then
             res2 = "OK"
          else
             res2 = "BUG"
          endif

Alternatively, we can use the same method as the third program: read from the string as if it were an internal file. We can do:

          integer :: pos, count3, ios
          character(len=10) :: token   ! each token is an integer string, so 10 is enough

          count3 = 0
          pos = 1
          do
             ! find next token: skip spaces
             start = verify(str3(pos:), ' ')   ! returns the first non-space
             if (start==0) exit
             start = start + pos - 1
             ! find next space
             next = scan(str3(start:), ' ')
             if (next==0) then
                 token = str3(start:)
                 pos = len_trim(str3)+1
             else
                 token = str3(start:start+next-2)
                 pos = start+next-1
             endif

             count3 = count3+1
             if (token == '0') exit

          enddo
